Name: D√©j√† Vu

Name: Idiocracy
Review: quite a few more slurs than I remembered... fewer great lines than I remembered, but they exist. not one to recommend to someone who hasn't seen it before.

Name: Ice Age
Review: Animation did not age well, and the story didn‚Äôt seem to have the Pixar-level second levels. Or maybe I was just too tired ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Name: Alita: Battle Angel
Review: Felt like they combined a YA story with an actually interesting story and left most of the interesting parts for the sequel. The romance and sport focus felt similar to The Phantom Menace in how they distracted from something that had promise. Oh well.

Name: The Fast and the Furious
Review: Just feels so low-budget compared to the sequels. Still fun and ridiculous.

Name: Under the Silver Lake
Review: I just didn't get it :( some fun weird parts, but a lot of gross stuff wrt women and homeless etc and the typical hollywood obsession with hollywood that I just don't care about.

Name: The Crow
Review: lmao

Name: 2 Fast 2 Furious
Review: still some weird effects, but much closer to the current ff feel. Fun and light.

Name: John Carter
Review: dumb as shit, weird as hell

Name: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
Review: delightful, but you can see spielberg already referncing his own movies repeatedly and showing a little lack of creativity at times.

Name: Pocahontas
Review: beautiful, and some great songs, but also ....

Name: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol
Review: Really not a fan of Patton in this, but the rest of the acting and action sequences are excellent

Name: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift
Review: Other than the lead being an obvious villain in the story, real fun! Honestly everything other than the lead is great.

Name: Rumble in the Bronx
Review: the fight sequences are so good, everything else is so bad

Name: Once Upon a Time‚Ä¶ in Hollywood
Review:
I went in to this expecting another annoying movie by a hollywood director about hollywood (Hail Caesar, La La Land, etc) where it's only entertaining if you have a debilitating level of knowledge of hollywood history. It was... a bit better than that? Still very indulgent and impossible to follow if you didn't have that hollywood history, but the acting was excellent and some scenes were exceptional. 

Could have been significantly shorter, would probably have been better as straight fiction telling the same story rather than historical fiction. 

Also the Bruce Lee scene was pretty shitty and unnecessary.

Name: Kingsman: The Golden Circle
Review:
Incredibly dumb, with a remarkable lack of fun compared with the previous movie.

Also, I feel weird getting worked up about any specific issue given how many I had, but this movie came out in 2017 and they're constantly talking about marijuana users as criminals who only get marijuana from drug cartels?

Name: 6 Underground
Review: Incredibly hard to follow, awful writing and the acting doesn't help, just gross and weird story. I'm not sure what's redeeming here?

Name: Sweet Virginia
Review: A strange movie: every component seems to be done well, but the final product doesn't really come together in a memorable fashion.

Name: A Serious Man
Review: I see the similarity to the book of Job: Competent, at times hilarious, and in the end there just isn't much there other than the presuppositions you bring along.

Name: Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace
Review: You can see the basics of a beginning of a good trilogy- the fall of Anakin stemming from being too old and too emotionally attached, the rise of Palpatine and the long machinations he has planned- but my god everything in the execution is just miserable. At least some of the action scenes are enjoyable. Tough to identify the line between bad acting, bad writing, and bad directing, but some combination of the three makes it all seem just goofy.

Name: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones
Review: Anakin and Obiwan's relationship just seems weird: this is our first real introduction, and from the first scene they're bickering. Padmi and Anakin aren't any better- he starts in love, she falls for him despite Anakin remaining a complete ass the entire film. Again, the action scenes are reasonably fun, and again the long-running story arcs make sense on paper, but long stretches of just bad movie.

Name: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith
Review:
Similar goofiness to the first two prequels. Anakin's relationship with Obiwan feels less and less healthy, especially when Anakin gets protective of Obiwan despite spending all of Ep. II shitting on him. It makes that movies relationship feel abusive on the part of Obiwan. On the other hand, some of the early scenes between them actually have jokes that land!
The WWII inspired battle moments are very fun to watch and some of the few moments where the battles are visually clear. The rest of the battles are both opaque and go on forever. The lightsaber fight acrobatics continue to be hilariously goofy and unnecessary, especially when the fighter is 60 years old or shitty CGI.
Still somehow fun to watch, but similar to Ep. II in that there are long stretches of boring nothingness.

Name: Honeyland
Review: Shockingly ugly and bleak, extraordinarily intimate, a very hard film to enjoy.

Name: Little Women
Review:
Wonderful story, for the most part wonderful acting (Watson's accent slips at times), wonderful set/costume design and cinematography. 

I hate to nitpick, but there were just too many aspects (editing, writing, overall story choices) that felt slightly off for me to rate it much higher than this. Probably just not my genre, so I won't just list errata.

Overall, enjoyable even with some distracting misses.

Name: Event Horizon
Review: The jump-scare shit kind of sucks, and the set is a bit more goofy than I remember, but still a fun horror movie with some fun body horror visuals.

Name: Furie
Review: paint by numbers with quality action scenes

Name: The Two Popes
Review: Extremely funny at times, with lots of excellent acting and dialogue and music. Anthony Hopkins might be too endearing for his own good. It's funny to call this hagiographic or preachy, but at times it does go overboard a bit.
Beautiful score, with excellent set pieces and scenery, but some of the cinematography was distracting and at times the movie felt a bit oscar-baity.

Name: Knives Out
Review:
I'm likely just reacting against all the hype here- definitely want to revisit in a year or too.

Very fun, well acted, love the costume/set pieces, but just wasn't as clever as some (either the movie itself or its fans) make it out to be?

Name: Logan Lucky
Review: Weirder messier Ocean's 11

Name: Jojo Rabbit
Review: Darkly funny that the only truly evil characters/actions in the movie is when the Americans kill a bunch of unarmed prisoners off-screen. Everyone else seems to get rehabilitated or treated as a joke.

Name: Free Fire
Review: Entertaining throughout, but at all times it feels like a mediocre copy of better movies. Still, loved Cillian Murphy, and hated the attempts at a Boston accent.

Name: The Score
Review: Simple, entertaining heist movie marred by just a terrible character/performance by Ed Norton.

Name: The Fugitive
Review: The actual story is meh, but the acting is excellent

Name: Dirty Harry
Review: Real strange and simple plot, and the character motivations are... shallow... but also there are some super cool scenes/shots that you just don't normally see in a shitty action movie.

Name: Portrait of a Lady on Fire
Review: Beautiful, and well acted, but some of the direction was a bit over the top

Name: 28 Days Later
Review: Man this hasn't aged well... I understand it's a good B movie, but remember that it still has all the marks of a B movie

Name: Killing Them Softly
Review: Never quite hits what it's aiming for, but at least it's trying to say something.

Name: Extraction
Review: 2/3 of a pretty good Man On Fire reboot, but the last 1/3 really goes over the top with the melodrama

Name: The Limey
Review: Simple yet sometimes over the top, conventional story with a unique edit

Name: Lethal Weapon
Review: Enjoyed the first half, then it went off the rails in a typical 80s action movie way.

Name: Frozen II
Review: Excellent visuals, but the story was all over the place and the songs were way worse than the first Frozen

Name: Dolemite Is My Name
Review: Really gets rolling about a third of the way through

Name: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker
Review: I mean, the action scenes are reasonably fun and the production value is high and it feels like a blockbuster, but the plot is just all over the place and not much of it seems to follow. Just an incredible waste of great acting and decent characters (at least they seemed interesting in the first sequel, nobody really develops into anything interesting).

Name: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Review: Garden State v2, but even harder to believe

Name: Good Time
Review: I actually loved the writing and acting and set design and everything, it's just an incredibly uncomfortable character to try to empathize with and follow for two hours. The textures and vibe felt like the end of an MDMA/LSD trip.

Name: Road to Perdition
Review: Oscar bait, but the acting was surprisingly bad in addition to hackey writing

Name: Ace Ventura: Pet Detective
Review: tough to see past all the parts that didn't age well.

Name: Super 8
Review: A Spielberg movie that gets the Michael Bay treatment.

Name: Starship Troopers
Review: Is it a satire slightly too subtle for my tastes, or a director trying to have it both ways? In either case, a surprisingly fun, funny film who's goofy acting is shielded by the self-mocking tone.

Name: Kedi
Review: Just phenomenally #goodvibes

Name: Knives Out
Review: still fun, still ham-fisted with the political call-outs

Name: The Old Guard

Name: Salt

Name: The Firm

Name: Gone Girl

Name: Red Dragon

Name: Enola Holmes
Review: incredible waste of some good actors

Name: Bastille Day

Name: Diamonds Are Forever

Name: Live and Let Die

Name: Draft Day

Name: Akira

Name: Moonraker

Name: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty

Name: Ava

Name: The Mechanic
